q: a target. Labour's deputy leader Harriet Harman told Sky's Dermot Murnaghan that allegations of illegal activity must be investigated.`` Hacking into people's phones is illegal,'' she said. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced.`` Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist. The scandal has already cost Number 10 spin doctor Andy Coulson his job amid claims he presided over the illegal action at the tabloid. The former editor has always denied knowing that phone-hacking was taking place

that the democratization talk was something that emerged after WMD did not turn up in Iraq.`` It was hard to know exactly where the President's far-reaching language about democracy originated,'' Donald Rumsfeld writes. It was not a large part of his original calculus in toppling Saddam's regime, at least from what I gleaned in private conversations and NSC meetings. I didn't hear rhetoric about democracy from Colin Powell or State Department officials. I know it did not come from the Department of Defense. Condoleezza Rice seemed to be the one top adviser who spoke that way, but it was not clear to me whether she was encouraging the President to use rhetoric about democracy or whether it was originating with the President. N.B.. We encourage readers to share and discuss their thoughtful and relevant comments about this There They Went Again by John H. Fund

Satya Nadella has deep experience in both our server business and online services, which will help accelerate our momentum while setting the course to deliver the cloud computing scenarios of the future, said Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer , in a statement. Satya Nadella replaces Microsoft veteran Bob Muglia as head of the highly profitable server business.
